file_content.text: I can offer you nothing.
Things are becoming very dangerous. Be careful in your travels, Cipher Nine.
You are proving yourself an asset, agent.
However, Keeper requested that I transfer your call to him upon mission completion.
Put me through.
Go ahead, then.
Lodenth out.
Do you have any idea what he wants?
He asked to speak to me?
Unfortunately, he does not inform me of his reasoning. Please hold.
I don't suppose he bothers you this much?
That man is a pest.
No. My interactions with him are minimal. Please hold.
Agent. You're to suspend all field operations immediately; you're needed elsewhere.
Needed for what, sir?
Needed?
An urgent matter.
I wasn't expecting to hear from you, Keeper.
This is a surprise.
Watcher Two is still your liaison to base, but I wanted to deliver these orders personally.
I don't have time to waste.
That's not for you to judge.
Darth Jadus wants to speak with you. You will proceed to his chambers for an audience.
You've met Darth Jadus, experienced his power. I suggest you treat him with respect and do as he asks.
Yes, sir. I'll keep that in mind.
I understand.
For what it's worth--I tried to shield you from this. But it seems it was unavoidable.
Why would he want to talk to me?
What's this about?
I told you on Hutta that he would reward success or failure appropriately. It seems he's decided now is the time.
I'm looking forward to chatting with a member of the Dark Council.
This will be enlightening.
Of course.
You will resume operations when this is finished, agent. Keeper out.
Well, that didn't sound so good.
Still, powerful men are the same across the galaxy. I'll bet your life that whatever else Jadus is, he's a powerful man, too.
Lodenth Kashar speaking. I have downloaded all files attached to the slave's datapad.
Watcher Two has authorized me to translate the contents. It will take time, but I am already accessing names and locations.
Do you have any updates for me?
Status report, please.
The Watchers have not alerted me to any new developments, but they are currently in conference.
I was expecting to hear from Watcher Two.
Where's my Watcher?
The Watchers are currently in conference. I do not expect it to last long.
Get to work.
I will do so.
I will begin translating the slave's messages as soon as you access them.
Watcher Two here. I'm receiving your signal. Mapping your location now.
Glad you made it through the jungle safely, agent. Ready to work?
I'm ready. Just standing by for the details.
Absolutely.
Anything that gets me away from the trees. I had my fill of nature walks on Hutta.
That jungle is disgusting.
I saw the satellite surveillance footage. But don't worry--our flora doesn't feed on chemical runoff.
Just tell me why I'm here. We don't have time for chat.
Don't get cute.
Of course. Let's get to business.
You may have noticed the chaos out there. There's a slave rebellion going on, and you're heading into the middle of it.
Our analyst charged with monitoring the rebellion is with me. His name is Lodenth Kashar--he can fill you in on the details.
It is pleasing to see you again. I will do my best to meet expectations; I have been observing the revolting slaves and believe my knowledge may be useful.
I will do my best to meet expectations, <FullName>. I have been observing the revolting slaves and believe my knowledge may be useful.
Go ahead, then.
Proceed.
How did the rebellion start? What's really going on?
Tell me about the slaves.
My expectations for you are rather low.
I doubt you know much.
I understand, and I apologize for putting you in this situation.
This rebellion began several months ago. The slaves--many of them aliens--were being used for construction, but they began fighting for freedom.
They are now organized and armed. Their camp is entrenched around the construction site. So far, they have held up under siege.
Imperial Intelligence is leaving concerns about the rebellion itself to the military. You're here for a specific slave--an alien named Jurithus.
I can extract him. What's his story?
Consider it done.
Are we talking about a violent extraction? Killing rebel slaves?
Will force be necessary?
Don't make this difficult, agent.
How am I supposed to find one slave in this mess?
You're joking.
It won't be easy, I'll give you that.
Jurithus was once owned by an anti-government radical who used slaves to carry messages to like-minded dissidents.
My analysis suggests Jurithus kept copies of those messages encoded in his native language. You will need to interrogate the slave leaders to find him.
I doubt the slave leaders will cooperate.
It'll be difficult.
You're right, but we're prepared for that.
Have we questioned the slave's former master?
Where's his owner now?
He's gone--dead at the hands of an overenthusiastic agent. That's why Minder Four is no longer with us.
Can I negotiate with them somehow?
Is interrogation necessary?
These people are traitors, not objects of sympathy. Besides, Lodenth has a better plan.
You were supplied at base with a medical kit and a syringe full of the SLV-16 serum.
You must incapacitate a slave leader. Shoot him and inject him with the serum. He will awaken in a suggestible state, and he will tell you where Jurithus is.
One way or another, I'll make sure he talks.
It'll get done.
Yes. The serum is most effective. I helped develop it.
How does SLV-16 work, exactly?
What is the serum?
Slaves on Dromund Kaas are conditioned to be susceptible to control technologies. SLV-16 is our latest means of negating a slave's willpower.
The serum leaves a slave helplessly obedient for one hour. After that, his mind is free again.
It seems needlessly cruel--beating and drugging a slave.
I'm uncomfortable with this.
I like that you have a conscience--but don't let it cloud your judgment. This is the best way to get what we need.
I will keep this channel open. As soon as you obtain Jurithus's messages, I will download them and begin translating.
Another reason why it's useful to have aliens on staff. In any case, good luck.
I like to think we're more than just our language skills.
Glad you find us "useful."
Of course. I didn't mean to offend.
And that's why it's useful to have an alien on staff. In any case, good luck.
I'll get Jurithus's messages.
Time to work.
Don't I get a kiss before I go?
[Flirt] I bet you'll miss me.
Sorry, but my holocom doesn't have that feature. Maybe when the network is upgraded.
I'm sure I'll have a good time.
Looking forward to it.
I mean it, agent--be careful. I don't like watching a partner get killed.
This'll be simple.
Of course. I should've realized.
You should find your targets inside the camp. Take a slave down, apply the serum and locate Jurithus.
This is the only way we can learn what the radicals are planning. Time's running out, agent.
It is always pleasing to see you well, agent.
I greet you respectfully, <FullName>, and offer you welcome to Dromund Kaas.
I am Lodenth Kashar. Can I assist you in some way?
What is it you do around here?
You work at Intelligence?
Since I have no official designation, my duties are flexible.
Most days, I assist the Watchers and analyze reports. When needed, I also provide psychological profiling of alien behavior patterns.
Because you and I are among the very few aliens with authority here, we must demonstrate our loyalty however we can, and not disappoint.
Most days, I assist Keeper and the Watchers, correlating data and analyzing reports. When needed, I also provide psychological profiling of alien behavior patterns.
Interesting. What kind of profiling?
Profiling?
Many aliens oppose the Empire. Many have brains that do not work like human brains. I attempt to bridge this gap through the science of xenopsychology.
Don't you have some sort of code name?
Just "Lodenth"?
No. I am simply Lodenth Kashar.
Official policy restricts designations to Basic-speakers. Since I cannot speak Basic, they assume I cannot grasp the importance of a Basic designation.
It pleases me that you are different. You can prove that some aliens truly love the Empire.
You're the only other alien I've seen in Imperial Intelligence.
Not many non-humans around.
Yes. Until your arrival, I was the only non-human assigned to headquarters. It is a privilege to be considered loyal.
You and I have the opportunity to prove that some aliens truly love the Empire. We must not disappoint.
Why would anyone doubt our loyalty?
I'm confused.
Our Empire was founded on a bloodline of humans and Sith, and the lords have always emphasized purity.
However, we appreciate what the Empire represents, and we do our part to contribute.
I don't intend to disappoint anyone.
I'll do my best.
I am certain this is true.
Neither of us is human but that doesn't make us the same. Fight your own battles.
I'm not like you, freak.
I apologize. It was not my intent to offend.
You're the only alien I've seen in Imperial Intelligence.
Not many non-humans around.
I am the only non-human currently assigned to Imperial Intelligence headquarters. There are others--such as your friend--in field operations.
You must have licked so many boots to get where you are today.
I am the only non-human currently assigned to Imperial Intelligence headquarters. Others are used for field operations, however.
Alien Intelligence agents must meet a particularly high standard for loyalty. Because the Empire was founded by humans and Sith, many believe that aliens cannot truly love the Empire.
This may or may not be a fallacy. Regardless, I am proud to serve in whatever capacity I can.
The truth is, we need all the help we can get.
Glad to have you.
I agree. It is a dangerous time for the Empire, and we must use whatever resources we have to ensure its safety.
You're a credit to your species.
Service becomes you.
I appreciate your... open-mindedness.
Now, you must attend to your business. Do not allow me to distract you further.
We don't need freaks like you filling the ranks of Imperial Intelligence.
Alien scum.
I am disappointed to hear that from you. It will not affect my performance, however.
Now is not the proper time. Your report is for Keeper.
Downloading all data now. Please activate holocommunicator to confirm, agent.
There are urgent matters demanding your attention. I am not permitted to assist you in the meantime.
The data here appears to match information you retrieved from Grathan's compound. Further study will be required.
I humbly suggest you return to the Citadel. I expect Keeper will want you present once all the data has been analyzed.
On my way.
Oh?
I expect Keeper will want all available agents very soon. I am not authorized to say anything else.
Until Keeper calls me back himself, he can sit tight--I've got tasks that won't wait.
I have other work out here.
As you say.
Lodenth out.
Looking forward to it.
Looking forward to it.
